SEARCH
Package librarySE.managers.reports

Class FineReportService

java.lang.Object
librarySE.managers.reports.FineReportService
public class FineReportService extends Object
Provides analytical reports related to fines within the library system.

This service class focuses on aggregating fine information from all borrowing records. It supports:

  • Calculating total fines per user
  • Summarizing fines by media type (e.g., BOOK, CD, JOURNAL)
  • Calculating total fines for all users combined

All calculations are performed based on the provided date, which ensures that overdue fines are evaluated consistently.

Thread-safety: Uses CopyOnWriteArrayList to allow safe concurrent reads.

Author:
Malak

  • Method Details

    • getTotalFinesForUser

      public BigDecimal getTotalFinesForUser(User user, LocalDate date)
      Calculates the total fines owed by a specific user as of the given date.
      Parameters:
      user - the user whose total fine is to be calculated
      date - the current date used to check overdue items
      Returns:
      total fine amount for the user, or BigDecimal.ZERO if none
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if user or date is null

    • getFinesByMediaType

      public Map<MaterialType,BigDecimal> getFinesByMediaType(User user, LocalDate date)
      Generates a breakdown of fines per MaterialType (e.g. BOOK, CD, JOURNAL) for a specific user.
      Parameters:
      user - the user whose fines are to be analyzed
      date - the date used for overdue fine calculation
      Returns:
      a map where each key is a material type and each value is the total fine
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if user or date is null

    • getTotalFinesForAllUsers

      public Map<User,BigDecimal> getTotalFinesForAllUsers(LocalDate date)
      Calculates the total fines for all users in the system.

      Useful for generating administrative or financial reports.

      Parameters:
      date - the date used to calculate overdue fines
      Returns:
      a map where the key is a User and the value is their total fine
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if date is null
